page.title: 14A CHURCHILL TEENAGER
page.content: I have lived in Churchill all my life of 17 years. When I was 3 I attended Playgroup until I was 5 when I joined the Primary School here which has now closed. Aged 11 I went to Chipping Norton Secondary School. I was a member of Churchill Brownies and then went to Kingham Guides as there were none in Churchill. Churchill is not exciting for young people; it is a small village with a high proportion of elderly people. There are not enough teenagers to support Youth activities. We have no shop, only a sub-Post office, a pub and a garage. Public transport is limited, so one needs a car. I am now in full-time education on a catering course at Banbury Tech. When it finishes I will have to leave the village to find employment as I doubt if there will be any here.
